intro: Diploclinium sublobatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of yellow or greenish-white. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
